awe6.interfaces.IAudioManager

type
interface
Provides functions to control playback of audio: sounds, music etc.

Instance Variables

isMute(default,_set_isMute) : Bool

If true all audio playback is silenced.

Instance Methods

isPlaying( ?id : String, ?audioChannelType : EAudioChannel ) : Bool

parameters
?id The unique id of the audio media asset under investigation. If null will search entire audioChannel for activity.
?audioChannelType If specified will only investigate the specified channel. If ommitted will investigate all channels.
returns
Returns true if a match is found, otherwise false.
Discover if a specified sound is playing.

start( id : String, ?audioChannelType : EAudioChannel, ?loops : Int, ?startTime : Int, ?volume : Float, ?pan : Float, ?isIgnoredIfPlaying : Bool, ?onCompleteCallback : Void -> Void ) : Void

parameters
id The unique id of the audio media asset. Can be the className of a loaded asset library.
?audioChannelType Sounds can be assigned specific channels to allow transformation of groups of related sounds.
?loops How many times the specified sound should repeat. Set to -1 for continual loop.
?startTime Time displacement (ms) from the start of the sound file.
?volume Adjusts this sound's amplitude relative to the audioChannel. 0...1: 0 is silent, 1 is full.
?pan Adjusts this sound's stereo effect relative to the audioChannel. -1...1: -1 is left channel only, 0 is central, 1 is right channel only.
?isIgnoredIfPlaying If true and this sound is already playing in the specified channel the start request will be skipped. If false there is a potential for the same sound to play over the top of itself.
?onCompleteCallback Callback method to execute on sound complete.
Begin playback of any specified sound. Optional parameters allow further control.

stop( ?id : String, ?audioChannelType : EAudioChannel ) : Void

parameters
?id The unique id of the audio media asset intended to be stopped. If null will stop all sounds on the specific audioChannel.
?audioChannelType If specified will only stop sounds assigned to this channel.
End playback of any specified sound. To stop all sounds on all channels, leave all parameters blank.

transform( ?id : String, ?audioChannelType : EAudioChannel, ?volume : Float, ?pan : Float, ?asRelative : Bool ) : Void

parameters
?id The unique id of the audio media asset intended to be transformed. If null will transform all sounds on the specific audioChannel.
?audioChannelType If specified will only transform sounds assigned to this channel.
?volume Adjusts this sound's amplitude relative to the audioChannel. 0...1: 0 is silent, 1 is full.
?pan Adjusts this sound's stereo effect relative to the audioChannel. -1...1: -1 is left channel only, 0 is central, 1 is right channel only.
?asRelative If true will adjust sounds relative to their original transformation. If false will set them as absolute values.
Adjusts the playback of any specified sound. To adjust all sounds, ommit id and audioChannelType.
